title: Present Perfect form: have/has + V3
description: Формирование Present Perfect: have/has + V3, выбор have/has, формы V3 и базовые модели утверждений, вопросов и отрицаний.
learning_objectives: Собирать утвердительные, отрицательные и вопросительные предложения в Present Perfect
Выбирать have или has по подлежащему
Использовать форму V3 (регулярную и неправильную) и типичные маркеры

blocks.title: Present Perfect строится по формуле have/has + V3 (past participle). Это вспомогательный глагол have/has плюс основная форма в третьей колонке (V3). В настоящем времени меняется только вспомогательный глагол, а V3 остается неизменной.

theory.content_md:
Present Perfect строится по формуле **have/has + V3** (past participle). Это вспомогательный глагол **have/has** плюс основная форма в третьей колонке (V3). В настоящем времени меняется только вспомогательный глагол, а V3 остается неизменной.

Форма показывает связь с настоящим (результат, опыт), но в этой главе мы фокусируемся на конструкции: именно **have/has** несет грамматическую информацию, а V3 — лексический смысл действия.

blocks.title: Выбор have или has зависит от подлежащего, как и в Present Simple. Have используется с I/you/we/they и множественным числом; has — с he/she/it и единичными существительными/именами. Это единственное согласование в Present Perfect.

theory.content_md: Выбор **have** или **has** зависит от подлежащего, как и в Present Simple. **Have** используется с I/you/we/they и множественным числом; **has** — с he/she/it и единичными существительными/именами. Это единственное согласование в Present Perfect.

common_mistakes.why: С подлежащим в 3-м лице единственного числа используется has, а не have.

blocks.title: V3 (past participle) — это третья форма глагола. У регулярных глаголов V3 совпадает с V2 и имеет окончание -ed (worked, played). У неправильных V3 нужно запоминать отдельно (go – went – gone, write – wrote – written).

theory.content_md:
V3 (past participle) — это третья форма глагола. У регулярных глаголов V3 совпадает с V2 и имеет окончание **-ed** (worked, played). У неправильных V3 нужно запоминать отдельно (go – went – **gone**, write – wrote – **written**).

Важно не подставлять V2 вместо V3: в Present Perfect всегда используется именно V3.

common_mistakes.wrong: I have went to the bank.
common_mistakes.right: I have gone to the bank.
common_mistakes.why: В Present Perfect нужна форма V3, а не V2: go – went – gone.

examples.text: She has worked here for three years.
examples.translation: Она работает здесь уже три года.

examples.text: I have written two emails today.

blocks.title: Отрицание строится с not после have/has: have not (haven't) + V3, has not (hasn't) + V3. В вопросе вспомогательный глагол переносится на первое место: Have/Has + subject + V3?.

theory.content_md:
Отрицание строится с **not** после have/has: **have not (haven't) + V3**, **has not (hasn't) + V3**. В вопросе вспомогательный глагол переносится на первое место: **Have/Has + subject + V3?**.

Не добавляй do/does: в Present Perfect вспомогательный уже есть — have/has.

common_mistakes.why: В вопросе Present Perfect используется have/has, без do/did.

blocks.title: В кратких ответах повторяется только have/has: Yes, I have. / No, she hasn't. Полный смысл уже понятен из вопроса. В разговорной речи часто используют сокращения: I've, you've, he's, she's, it's, we've, they've.

theory.content_md:
В кратких ответах повторяется только have/has: **Yes, I have. / No, she hasn't.** Полный смысл уже понятен из вопроса. В разговорной речи часто используют сокращения: **I've, you've, he's, she's, it's, we've, they've**.

Сокращения не меняют порядок слов и используются только в утверждениях/отрицаниях, но не в кратких ответах (обычно: *Yes, I have*, а не *Yes, I've*).

blocks.title: Частотные наречия already, just, ever, never обычно ставятся между have/has и V3: have already done. Yet чаще стоит в конце отрицаний и вопросов: haven't done it yet / Have you done it yet?.

theory.content_md:
Частотные наречия **already, just, ever, never** обычно ставятся между have/has и V3: **have already done**. **Yet** чаще стоит в конце отрицаний и вопросов: **haven't done it yet / Have you done it yet?**.

Если в предложении есть обстоятельство времени вроде *today, this week*, оно обычно ставится в конце: **have finished today**.

examples.text: I have already sent the email.

questions.explanation: Present Perfect uses have/has + V3: *have finished*. The auxiliary comes before the main verb, and the main verb is in V3.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "They ___ finished the meeting." (I/you/we/they)
questions.explanation: With I/you/we/they we use **have** in Present Perfect. The main verb stays in V3: *have finished*.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "She ___ completed the form." (he/she/it)
questions.explanation: With he/she/it the auxiliary is **has**. The verb **completed** is V3 and does not change.

questions.prompt: Present Perfect is formed with have/has + V3.
questions.explanation: The construction is have/has + past participle (V3). The auxiliary carries the tense, the V3 carries the meaning.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: "I ___ my keys."
questions.explanation: Present Perfect requires have + V3: *have lost*. Word order is auxiliary + V3, not the other way around.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about his new job:

choices.text: He have started his new job.
He has started his new job.
He has start his new job.

questions.explanation: Present Perfect needs **has + V3** for he/she/it. Only option b has the correct auxiliary and V3 form.

questions.prompt: Расставьте слова в правильном порядке:
questions.explanation: Standard order is Subject + have/has + V3 + object. Here it is: *I have finished the task.*

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence about sending a report:
questions.explanation: Present Perfect needs have + V3, so *have sent* is correct. The other options break either word order or V3 form.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "The train ___ left." (he/she/it)
questions.explanation: The noun *the train* is singular, so we use **has**. The V3 *left* stays the same.

questions.prompt: In Present Perfect, V3 does not change for different subjects.
questions.explanation: Only the auxiliary changes between have and has. The V3 form is the same for all subjects.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: "She ___ her ticket."
questions.explanation: With she we use **has**, and the main verb must be V3: *found*. That makes option a correct.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "We ___ the tickets." (I/you/we/they)
questions.explanation: With we the auxiliary is **have**. The full form is *have bought* with V3 after the auxiliary.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: "Tom ___ already arrived."
questions.explanation: Tom is he, so Present Perfect uses **has**. The auxiliary agrees with the subject.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "I ___ finished my shift." (I/you/we/they)
questions.explanation: With I we use **have**, not has. The V3 comes after it: *have finished*.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "My sister ___ moved to Oslo." (he/she/it)
questions.explanation: *My sister* is third person singular, so we use **has**. The form does not use -s on the main verb.

questions.prompt: With plural subjects we use has in Present Perfect.
questions.explanation: Plural subjects take **have**, not has. Has is only for he/she/it and singular nouns.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence about the dogs:
questions.explanation: *Dogs* is plural, so the auxiliary is **have**. Option a has the correct agreement and V3.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about parents arriving:
questions.explanation: Plural subject *parents* needs **have**. The V3 is *arrived*, so only option b is correct.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "He ___ just called." (he/she/it)
questions.explanation: With he we use **has**. The adverb *just* goes between has and V3.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: "We ___ already paid."
questions.explanation: With we, Present Perfect uses **have**. The auxiliary does the agreement for number and person.

questions.prompt: Names like Anna or Carlos take has in Present Perfect.
questions.explanation: A single name is a singular subject, so it takes **has**. The main verb stays in V3.

questions.prompt: Расставьте слова в правильном порядке:
questions.explanation: With the singular subject *our teacher*, we use **has**. The normal order is Subject + has + V3 + object.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence with you:
questions.explanation: With you we use **have**, not has. The V3 of *leave* is *left*, so option b is correct.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "The company ___ opened a new office." (he/she/it)
questions.explanation: *The company* is singular, so the auxiliary is **has**. The V3 *opened* follows it.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct V3: "go – went – ___"
questions.explanation: The irregular verb *go* has V3 **gone**. Present Perfect always uses V3, not V2.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "She has ___ the letter." (write)
questions.explanation: The V3 of *write* is **written**. Present Perfect needs have/has + V3.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "We have ___ the door." (close)
questions.explanation: Regular verbs form V3 with -ed, so **closed** is correct. The V3 equals V2 here.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about a broken phone:
questions.explanation: The V3 of *break* is **broken**, not broke. Present Perfect always uses V3 after have/has.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct V3 for *see*:
questions.explanation: *See* is irregular: see – saw – **seen**. Use V3 after have/has.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "He has ___ the dishes." (wash)
questions.explanation: Regular verbs use -ed for V3, so **washed** is correct. The auxiliary already shows tense.

questions.prompt: For regular verbs, V2 and V3 are usually the same.
questions.explanation: Regular verbs take -ed in both V2 and V3. That is why *worked* and *played* are the same in both forms.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct option: "They have ___ early."
questions.explanation: The V3 of *come* is **come**, not came. Present Perfect needs have/has + V3.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about breakfast:
questions.explanation: The V3 of *eat* is **eaten**. Only option b uses the correct past participle.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "I have ___ the report." (finish)
questions.explanation: Regular verbs add -ed to make V3, so **finished** is correct. The auxiliary is have.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct V3 for *take*:
questions.explanation: *Take* is irregular: take – took – **taken**. The V3 is used in Present Perfect.

questions.prompt: In Present Perfect, it is correct to use V2 after have/has.
questions.explanation: Present Perfect requires V3, not V2. Using V2 (like *went*) is a common error.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct question about the task:

choices.text: Do you have finished the task?

questions.explanation: Questions in Present Perfect use inversion: **Have/Has + subject + V3**. We do not use do/does here.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "She ___ not called yet." (negative, he/she/it)
questions.explanation: Negative is **has not + V3** with he/she/it. The not goes after the auxiliary.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "They ___ not arrived." (negative, I/you/we/they)
questions.explanation: With I/you/we/they, the negative is **have not + V3**. The auxiliary is have, not has.

questions.prompt: In Present Perfect questions, we use do/does before the subject.
questions.explanation: Present Perfect already has an auxiliary (have/has). The question is formed by moving have/has to the front.

questions.explanation: In questions, the auxiliary goes first: **Has + subject + V3**. *Yet* typically goes at the end.

questions.explanation: The negative is formed with have not + V3. We do not use do/does with Present Perfect.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "___ you eaten?" (question, I/you/we/they)
questions.explanation: Questions start with the auxiliary. With you we use **have**: *Have you eaten?*

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "___ she finished?" (question, he/she/it)
questions.explanation: With he/she/it the auxiliary is **has**, and it goes before the subject in a question.

questions.prompt: In Present Perfect negatives, not comes after the main verb.
questions.explanation: Not comes after the auxiliary have/has: *has not finished*. The main verb stays in V3.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct question about the match today:

choices.text: Did your team has won today?

questions.explanation: Present Perfect questions use **Has/Have + subject + V3**. No did/does is used.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about seeing it:

choices.text: Do you have not seen it?

questions.explanation: The auxiliary is have, and the main verb must be V3: *seen*. Option b has the correct form.

questions.prompt: Choose the best short answer: "Have you finished?"
questions.explanation: Short answers repeat only the auxiliary: *Yes, I have.* Contractions are not typical in short answers.

questions.prompt: Choose the best short answer: "Has she arrived?"
questions.explanation: Short negative answers use **hasn't** or **haven't** with the subject. Option a is the standard form.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "I've ___ the email." (send)
questions.explanation: *I've* is a contraction of *I have*. After it we use V3: *sent*.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "She's ___ home." (прийти)
questions.explanation: *She's* = *She has* in Present Perfect. The V3 of *come* is **come**.

questions.prompt: It is normal to say: "Yes, I've" as a short answer.
questions.explanation: Short answers usually use the full auxiliary: *Yes, I have.* Contractions are common in statements, not short answers.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence with a contraction:
questions.explanation: *We've* is the correct contraction of *we have*. The apostrophe replaces the missing letters.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about short answers:
questions.explanation: Short answers use the full auxiliary: *Yes, I have.* Contractions and *has* with I are incorrect.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "They've ___ the door." (close)
questions.explanation: *They've* = *They have*. The main verb must be V3, which is **closed**.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct short answer: "Have we met before?"
questions.explanation: Short answers repeat only the auxiliary. *Yes, we have* matches the question form.

questions.prompt: Contractions like I've or she's are formed from have/has + subject.
questions.explanation: In Present Perfect, *I've* means *I have* and *she's* means *she has*. The contraction does not change the verb form.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "He's ___ a mistake." (make)
questions.explanation: *He's* = *He has*. The V3 of *make* is **made**, so the sentence is *He's made a mistake*.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence with ellipsis:

choices.text: I've finished, and she has too.
I finished, and she has too.
I've finished, and she too has.

questions.explanation: The contraction *I've* is correct for *I have*. Using *has* alone is acceptable in ellipsis: *she has too*.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct placement: "I have ___ finished."
questions.explanation: Adverbs like *already* usually go between have/has and V3. *Yet* is used mainly in negatives and questions.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "She has ___ seen this movie." (никогда)
questions.explanation: *Never* goes between has and V3: *has never seen*. This is the typical placement in Present Perfect.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "Have you finished ___?" (еще)
questions.explanation: In questions, *yet* usually goes at the end. The rest of the structure is Have + subject + V3.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence with yet:
questions.explanation: *Yet* is typically used in negatives and questions, often at the end. Option b has the correct negative and placement.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence with just:
questions.explanation: *Just* goes between have/has and V3: *have just arrived*. That is the standard placement.

questions.prompt: Yet is usually placed at the end of questions or negatives in Present Perfect.
questions.explanation: The common position is end: *Have you finished yet?* or *I haven't finished yet.* This is a standard pattern.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "I have ___ been to Japan." (когда-либо)
questions.explanation: *Ever* usually sits between have/has and V3. This position is typical in Present Perfect questions and statements.

questions.correct_answer: We have already cleaned the room.
questions.explanation: The adverb *already* goes between have and V3. The normal order is subject + have + adverb + V3.

questions.prompt: Choose the correct sentence with never:
questions.explanation: *Never* normally comes between has and V3: *has never met*. Option a follows this placement.

questions.prompt: Заполните пропуск: "They have ___ finished their project." (уже)
questions.explanation: *Already* typically goes between have/has and V3. This is the standard placement in affirmative sentences.

questions.prompt: In Present Perfect, adverbs like already and just usually go before have/has.
questions.explanation: These adverbs usually go between have/has and V3, not before the auxiliary. Example: *have already finished*.

questions.prompt: Find the correct sentence about placement of yet:
questions.explanation: *Yet* normally appears at the end of the question: *Have you finished yet?* The other placements are unnatural.
